cold_snaps.status: At present, there is no cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps occur annually.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4-27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: There is no heatwave at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwaves, with an average of 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Today's storm ranked 8th for total rainfall with 13.04mm having fallen, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  8.6mm per hour fell at points during the storm which lasted 7.9 hours.  Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 27.64mm over 15.9 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate climaxed at 27.0mm per hour today (ranking top from our records), resulting in 7.99mm of total rain in 2.0 hours.

storm.status: On 23 November 2024, rainfall persisted for 23.2 hours, accumulating 24.56mm at falling at 6.4mm per hour at times.
There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest rainy periods recorded.  This is ranked 5th since records began in August 2024.  The current stretch started on 26 August 2025 and has lasted 9 days.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (206°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1754 miles.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 78.27 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.0°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.4 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1649 m) and inside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 60.8m lower than yesterday, 546.0m lower than the past week, 1649.0m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 713m to a maximum of 1594m, averaging 1006.2m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1552.2m and 2660m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; like a nice, warm day. Also, oppressively muggy and sticky and calm and still conditions are expected. Some rain can be expected, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
